definition: one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus

sentences.english: I leave that moment, that twilight of the background on my mind occupied.
sentences.chinese: 我在離去那刻，那風燭殘年的背景就在我腦海佔據了。

sentences.english: Try to understand that my age is not long but survived.
sentences.chinese: 試着去了解我已經是風燭殘年來日不多。

sentences.english: He is a sick old man who poses no threat to the government.
sentences.chinese: 他已風燭殘年，對政府不能構成威脅。

sentences.english: It was about half a century since we last met, and we were now both in our declining years.
sentences.chinese: 掐指一算，分手快半個世紀了，現在都已是風燭殘年。

sentences.english: Don't argue with him. He has already got one foot in the grave.
sentences.chinese: 別跟他爭了，他已經是風燭殘年的人了。

sentences.english: True, there were some old women.
sentences.chinese: 的確，有些婦人已經風燭殘年。
